benefits.title: Effect of medium-chain triglycerides on growth performance, nutrient digestibility, plasma metabolites and antioxidant capacity in weanling pigs
benefits.summary: MCTs improve growth performance, nutrient utilization, and antioxidant ability of weanling piglets.

benefits.title: The Effects of Medium-Chain Triglyceride Oil Supplementation on Endurance Performance and Substrate Utilization in Healthy Populations: A Systematic Review
benefits.summary: MCT oil showed very little to no ergogenic effects on exercise performance and substrate utilization in healthy populations.

benefits.title: Increasing Carotenoid Bioaccessibility from Yellow Peppers Using Excipient Emulsions: Impact of Lipid Type and Thermal Processing.
benefits.summary: MCT oil in excipient emulsions can increase carotenoid bioaccessibility from yellow peppers, potentially benefiting human health.
benefits.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

benefits.title: Medium-chain triglycerides improved cognition and lipid metabolomics in mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease patients with APOE4-/-: A double-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled crossover trial.
benefits.summary: MCT oil significantly reduced cognitive decline in mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease patients with APOE4-/-.

benefits.title: The addition of medium-chain triglycerides to a purified fish oil-based diet alters inflammatory profiles in mice.
benefits.summary: MCT oil addition to a purified fish oil-based diet decreases the host response to inflammatory challenge, potentially benefiting therapeutic interventions for chronic inflammation.

benefits.title: Oleic acid, hydroxytyrosol and n-3 fatty acids collectively modulate colitis through reduction of oxidative stress and IL-8 synthesis; in vitro and in vivo studies.
benefits.summary: MCT oil increases susceptibility to colitis through oxidative damage and IL-8 synthesis in intestinal epithelial cells.

benefits.title: Lipid-Lowering Effects of Medium-Chain Triglyceride-Enriched Coconut Oil in Combination with Licorice Extracts in Experimental Hyperlipidemic Mice.
benefits.summary: Oral administration of medium chain-triglyceride-enriched coconut oil (MCT-MCO) may impede hyperlipidemia and hepatosteatosis by curtailing hepatic lipid synthesis.
benefits.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

benefits.title: Medium chain triglycerides (MCT): State-of-the-art on chemistry, synthesis, health benefits and applications in food industry.
benefits.summary: MCT oil permits unique metabolic pathways and energy production rates, making it a high-value functional food.
benefits.journal: Comprehensive reviews in food science and food safety

benefits.title: Beta-Hydroxybutyrate (BHB), Glucose, Insulin, Octanoate (C8), and Decanoate (C10) Responses to a Medium-Chain Triglyceride (MCT) Oil with and without Glucose: A Single-Center Study in Healthy Adults
benefits.summary: MCT oil plus glucose consumption improves scores for arithmetic and vocabulary subtests.

benefits.title: Pilot feasibility and safety study examining the effect of medium chain triglyceride supplementation in subjects with mild cognitive impairment: A randomized controlled trial
benefits.summary: MCT oil supplementation increased serum ketone bodies and improved memory in subjects with mild cognitive impairment.

side effects.title: Medium-chain Triglyceride Ketogenic Diet, An Effective Treatment for Drug-resistant Epilepsy and A Comparison with Other Ketogenic Diets
side effects.summary: The MCTKD is associated with gastrointestinal side effects like diarrhea, vomiting, bloating, and cramps.

side effects.title: Insulin and Ketone Responses to Ingestion of Medium and Long-chain Triglycerides in Man
side effects.summary: MCT oil ingestion leads to a significant rise in serum ketones and immunoreactive insulin, with a slight fall in serum glucose.

side effects.title: Efficacy of supplemental MCT oil on seizure reduction of adult drug-resistant epilepsy - a single-center open-label pilot study.
side effects.summary: MCT oil supplementation reduced seizure frequency in study participants, with reported side effects including mild nausea, stomachache, and loose stools.

side effects.title: Marked Seizure Reduction after MCT Supplementation
side effects.summary: MCT oil supplementation may provide better seizure control in some patients, but higher doses may cause diarrhea and flatulence.

side effects.title: Medium chain triglyceride (MCT) rich, paclitaxel loaded self nanoemulsifying preconcentrate (PSNP): a safe and efficacious alternative to Taxol.
side effects.summary: MCT oil-loaded paclitaxel preconcentrate (PSNP) showed negligible hemolysis and histamine release compared to Taxol, making it a safer vehicle with potential clinical benefits.

side effects.title: Design of novel tacrolimus formulations with chemically synthesized oils for oral lymphatic delivery
side effects.summary: MCT oil increases tacrolimus blood exposure, but adding 10% glyceryl monostearate (GMS) to MCT significantly decreases drug blood exposure without requiring a large amount of oil.

side effects.title: [A ketogenic diet: is this a valid alternative in refractory epilepsy].
side effects.summary: No serious side effects were seen apart from gastrointestinal symptoms, which improved when the quantity of MCT oil was reduced.

side effects.title: Dieta cetogénica: ¿una alternativa válida en epilepsias refractarias?
side effects.summary: No serious side-effects were seen apart from gastrointestinal symptoms, which improved when the quantity of MCT oil was reduced.

side effects.title: Fish oil supplementation in the parenteral nutrition of critically ill medical patients: a randomised controlled trial
side effects.summary: Fish oil supplementation in parenteral nutrition did not affect inflammation or clinical outcome in critically ill medical patients.

side effects.title: Beta-Hydroxybutyrate (BHB), Glucose, Insulin, Octanoate (C8), and Decanoate (C10) Responses to a Medium-Chain Triglyceride (MCT) Oil with and without Glucose: A Single-Center Study in Healthy Adults
side effects.summary: MCT oil plus glucose consumption showed improved scores for arithmetic and vocabulary subtests.

dosage.title: Causes of reduced survival of neonatal pigs by medium-chain triglycerides: blood metabolite and behavioral activity approaches.
dosage.summary: Orally dosed 6 mL/kg BW.75 of MCT oil reduced milk intake and weight gain in 1- to 2-day-old pigs, but did not affect mortality of small pigs.

dosage.title: Biopharmaceutical studies of lipid-containing oral dosage forms: Relationship between drug absorption rate and digestibility of vehicles
dosage.summary: MCT preparations in oral dosage forms showed higher serum levels of SL-512 compared to MBLA preparations, suggesting digestion of the lipid was a major premise for absorption.

dosage.title: Lipase‐catalyzed production of medium‐chain triacylglycerols from palm kernel oil distillate: Optimization using response surface methodology
dosage.summary: The optimum MCT yield is 73.3% using 2 wt-% enzyme dosage, a molecular sieves concentration of 1 wt-%, a reaction temperature of 90°C, a reaction time of 10 hours, and a molar substrate ratio of 4 : 1.
dosage.journal: European Journal of Lipid Science and Technology

dosage.title: Use of Oxandrolone to Promote Growth in Neonates following Surgery for Complex Congenital Heart Disease: An Open-Label Pilot Trial.
dosage.summary: 0.1 mg/kg/day in MCT oil was found to have the lowest decline in weight-for-age z-score among neonates after surgery for complex CHD.

dosage.title: Toxoplasmosis and Lymphoma: The Mimickers
dosage.summary: The patient successfully followed a ketogenic diet with above average blood sugar using MCT oil and additional magnesium at dosage 350 mg/day.
dosage.journal: Indian Journal of Medical and Paediatric Oncology : Official Journal of Indian Society of Medical & Paediatric Oncology

dosage.title: Evidence of coexisting microemulsion droplets in oil-in-water emulsions revealed by 2D DOSY 1H NMR.
dosage.summary: 1 wt% MCT is the upper boundary for the appearance of nanoemulsion phase in oil-in-water emulsions.
dosage.journal: Journal of colloid and interface science

dosage.title: The n-3 Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids Supplementation Improved the Cognitive Function in the Chinese Elderly with Mild Cognitive Impairment: A Double-Blind Randomized Controlled Trial
dosage.summary: n-3 PUFA supplementation (480 mg DHA and 720 mg EPA per day) improved cognitive function in people with mild cognitive impairment.

dosage.title: Bergamot Essential Oil: A Method for Introducing It in Solid Dosage Forms
dosage.summary: The conjugate BEO/QA-Ch-MCD stabilizes volatile compounds, eliminates unpleasant taste, and converts the oil into a solid dosage form suitable for powders, granules, and tablets.

dosage.title: The Effects of Medium-Chain Triglyceride Oil Supplementation on Endurance Performance and Substrate Utilization in Healthy Populations: A Systematic Review
dosage.summary: MCT oil showed very little to no ergogenic effects on exercise performance and substrate utilization in healthy populations.

dosage.title: Utilization of medium-chain triglycerides by neonatal pigs: effects of emulsification and dose delivered.
dosage.summary: 6 mL of emulsified MCT oil in a 30% Tween 80 emulsion was fed to neonatal pigs, resulting in plasma octanoate concentrations increasing linearly.
